bibl.title: John McKinnon vs. The United States. Affidavit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States 9th Judicial Circuit

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES 9th. jUDICIAL DIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTION, northern WESTERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of John McKinnon for A WRIT of HABEAS CORPUS.

State of Washington, County of King.
ss
div1.p: Jas. L. Crotty, being first duly sworn upon oath depose and say: I am the attorney for the above named John McKinnon, a citizen of the United States of America. That the authorities of of British Columbia are seeking to take the said John McKinnon from the United States to the Province of British Columbia for an alleged offense committed therein. I know that the said John McKinnon has no means with which to bear the expenses of this proceeding, and has no property upon which he can raise money with which to pay the expense of filing the papers in this cause and to pay for the service of the writ herein sought. I make this affidavit in support of said John McKinnon's petition for writ of Habeas Corpus, that he may be allowed to maintain this proceeding in forma pauperis. For the further reason that an emergency exists and the defendant has not ample time in which to obtain thee assistance of friends. This affiant further says that he has received no compensation for his the services whatever, for the reason that said John McKinnon had nothing with which to pay therefor. That this affiant is interested as attorney for said John McKinnon for the reason he believes his cause to be meritorious and that justice be done.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 13th. day of January, A. D. 1897.
div1.ab: Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle, Washington.
In the United States Circuit Court FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In the Matter of the Application of John McKinnon for A Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed Jan 14 1897 IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT.

Jas L Cotty
Attorney for Petitioner
Filed Jan 14 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT A. Reeves Ayres, CLERK By H. M. Walther DEPUTY
